intro: Sida devredii, commonly known as the devredii sida, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Sida devredii is typically an annual or biennial herb, and it plays a minor role in local ecosystems as a source of nectar for insects.
